results.title: Graphing linear equations
results.creator_credit: Carla Cody Weaver, Bill Hanlon and KLVX (Television station : Las Vegas, Nev.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Algebra, you can do it”.
This program shows how to graph a linear equation by finding the value for x and y. It also familiarises students with the correct vocabulary to use when describing linear equations. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A guide accompanies this video.

results.title: Word problems 2: variables
results.creator_credit: Mark M Williams, Bill Hanlon and KLVX (Television station : Las Vegas, Nev.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Algebra, you can do it”.
This program shows how to write word problems with two variables in a mathematical way and how then to solve these equations by linear combination or substitution. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A guide accompanies this video.

results.title: Solving linear equations with one variable
results.creator_credit: Mark M Williams, Bill Hanlon and KLVX (Television station : Las Vegas, Nev.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Algebra, you can do it”.
This program introduces solving linear equations with one variable when the variable is a natural number. Students will be shown basic rules that will allow them to solve this type of equation. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A guide accompanies this video.

results.title: Mathematics for modern living
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Associates and ACCESS
results.brief_description: This series of instructional tapes aimed at lower to middle level secondary students covers the mathematical areas of probability, linear equations, counting techniques, graphing and variables.

results.title: Coordinate graphing 2
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Associates and ACCESS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics for modern living”.
This episode from the “Mathematics for modern living” series teaches the basics of graphing including the slope of the line, oblique, horizontal and vertical, then progresses onto graphing linear equations (slope intercept method), two firstdegree linear equations and graphing linear inequations. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A study guide accompanies this tape.

results.title: Probability 2
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Associates and ACCESS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics for modern living”.
This episode from the “Mathematics for modern living” series is a continuation of “Probability 1” (see 309029) and covers the areas of; formulas for finding permutations of n, probability of two mutually exclusive events and two independent events. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A study guide accompanies this tape.

results.title: Probability 1 : counting techniques
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Associates and ACCESS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics for modern living”.
This episode from the “Mathematics for modern living” series introduces the concepts of chance and probability through examples of everyday life. It discusses games of chance and everyday space, closely followed by counting techniques. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A study guide accompanies this tape.

results.brief_description: This series of videos was commissioned jointly by the Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy and the Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria. The series is intended for commercial building owners, operators and managers.

results.title: Energy efficient air
results.creator_credit: Mark Poole, John Hipwell, Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria and Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Energy management in commercial buildings”.
Designed as one of a series of videos commissioned by the Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy and the Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria, this video looks at ways commercial building owners, operators and managers can save energy and the environment. This episode looks at practical ways to reduce the energy consumption of air conditioning systems.

results.title: The Energy audit
results.creator_credit: Mark Poole, John Hipwell, Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria and Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Energy management in commercial buildings”.
Designed as part of a series of videos outlining practical ways to measure energy use in commercial buildings, this video concentrates on conducting an energy audit. In turn, this will help the building manager in completing an energy management program with the aim of identifying opportunities for energy cost saving.
